attributes.action: To recognise Her Late Majesty Queen Elizabeth II as "Queen Elizabeth The Great"
attributes.additional_details:
In a speech by the late Her Majesty The Queen on her 21st Birthday, published on 21 April 1947, she said:

"I declare before you all that my whole life whether it be long or short shall be devoted to your service and the service of our great imperial family to which we all belong."

We believe a vow has never more been kept as much as this one.

We believe it is would be in accordance with public mood that the second Elizabethean Age of Queen Elizabeth II should be officially recognised.
attributes.background:
The reign of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II was the longest ever of any British monarch.

The second Elizabethean age was characterised by The Queen's profound commitment to public service and faithful duty.

We believe this should be recognised by Parliament on behalf of her loyal subjects.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions that relate to honours and appointments, which includes calling for a monarch to be given a particular title.
